original:
The New Manufacturing Economy (NME) refers to the significant role of advanced manufacturing in the emergence of the New Economy. This term encompasses manufacturing processes that are enhanced by digital technologies, sophisticated systems, and a highly skilled workforce. The NME integrates networks, 3D printing, and various advanced capabilities into business strategies, thereby improving manufacturing practices.

Notably, Thomas Friedman cites Lawrence F. Katz, highlighting the importance of economic development strategies that involve collaboration among universities, high-tech manufacturers,

This term encompasses manufacturing processes that are enhanced by digital technologies, sophisticated systems, and a highly skilled Industry. The NME integrates networks, 3D printing, and various advanced capabilities into business strategies, thereby improving manufacturing practices.
